article.headline: Ball St. 57, N. Illinois 55
article.story: DEKALB, Ill. (AP) -- Anthony Newell scored 21 points and grabbed 12 rebounds and James Hughes made a layup at the buzzer as Ball State eked out a 57-55 win over Northern Illinois on Tuesday night. Peyton Stovall finished with 17 points for the Cardinals (9-16, 5-7 Mid-American), and his 14 first-half points helped Ball State take a 40-31 lead into the locker room. James Hughes made a layup at the buzzer to account for the Huskies' final margin. Quintan Lipkins came off the bench to score 11 points to lead Northern Illinois (6-18, 3-9). Newell made Ball State's final field goal to put the Cardinals ahead 55-52 with 1:42 remaining, and the Huskies could not make a shot on their ensuing possessions. Newell and Stovall each split a pair of free throws in the final 90 seconds for Ball State, while Mike McKinney did the same for Northern Illinois. The Huskies' bench outscored the Ball State reserves 34-10, but the Cardinals enjoyed a huge advantage at the foul line, where they converted 18-of-23 free throws, to the Huskies 5-of-10. Both teams' shooting lagged in the second half, as the Cardinals and Huskies combined to score 41 points while converting 30.6 percent of their field goal attempts.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
